content:
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-21296 was retracted, but status is still triaged. I already tried the propose disposition button, no effect.
Looking at the status workflow: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-21296?workflowName=HL7-SPEC%3A+Specification+Feedback+Workflow&stepId=2 retracted seems to be missing there?
Did the user who submit it actually retract it using Jira?
It looks like she did. I'll investigate
thanks lloyd. And yes, this issue was retracted through JIRA.
any updates on this one? Resolution is set to retracted, but the status is still triaged.
It's on my list. Won't get to it today though.

Lloyd, same issue with this ticket: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-25762 (Resolution is Retracted, but status is Triaged and I don't think I can close the issue). There's no current, pressing need to manually adjust this ticket. (cc @Dennis Patterson )
the workflow drop-down shows me an option to close if that's the next step

When I try to close I get my hand slapped:

Action is only possible if the issue is not linked (i.e. not identified as a ballot item or referenced by other issues)

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators.
(there's no zulip emoji for smack :wink: )

@Lloyd McKenzie - Any chance this made it to your list? I have a ballot comment that was Retracted, but I am unsure what to do with the jira:

https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-32691

Any input would be appreciated.

Retraction retracts the vote, it doesn't remove the comment. If it hadn't been triaged, the comment would have closed. Because it's been triaged, you need to disposition, though you can certainly find it not-persuasive if you wish.
